History has shown that once power is centralized, it can be challenging to decentralize, leading to potential risks to democracy in the long term. It is crucial to prioritize the preservation of democratic principles by limiting executive powers and upholding checks and balances as foundational pillars of our system.

While I acknowledge the widespread use of marijuana and the arguments for its legalization, I hold the position that it should remain illegal. This is not due to any specific consequences that may result from its legalization, but rather a fundamental belief that the substances we allow in our society should be held to a certain standard. Marijuana, in my view, does not meet that standard.
